verses.text: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou \add art\add* my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;
To see thy power and thy glory, so \add as\add* I have seen thee in the sanctuary.
Because thy loving-kindness \add is\add* better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
My soul shall be satisfied as \add with\add* marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise \add thee\add* with joyful lips:
When I remember thee upon my bed, \add and\add* meditate on thee in the \add night\add* watches.
Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.
But those \add that\add* seek my soul to destroy \add it\add* , shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.
But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
